profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born at Bridgetown Mills, Bucks County, near Middletown, Pa., May 21, 1795; pursued an academic course; engaged in agricultural pursuits; commissioner of Bucks County 1830-1833; treasurer 1833-1835; moved to Newtown, Pa., in 1837; associate judge of the court of common pleas of Bucks County 1838-1843; elected as a Whig to the Twenty-eighth Congress (March 4, 1843-March 3, 1845); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1844 to the Twenty-ninth Congress; engaged in the real estate business and as general business agent 1845-1865; chief burgess of Newtown 1848-1853; died in Newtown, Bucks County, Pa., on October 16, 1867; interment in the Newtown Friends Meeting Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: Account and receipt book, 1837-1839, 1 volume.
researchRecord.description: Account book includes inventory and receipts.

researchRecord.name: 1695-1909, 2 feet (300 items).
researchRecord.description: Correspondence, deeds, wills, account books, docket book (1819-1821), scrapbooks, travel notes, genealogical sketch, and library catalog. Catalog in library.

researchRecord.name: In the papers of Edward Benjamin Critchlow, ca. 1811-1933, 2 boxes.
researchRecord.description: Collection includes a letter from Michael Hutchinson Jenks to his sister, Eliza Pearson.
